before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"3hfu","text":"The assay requires several steps where liquids are added to and aspirated from live cell monolayers in a 96-well tissue culture plate. Ideally, optimize handling technique to minimize cell loss at these steps before running the full protocol. Cell loss will reduce assay signal and introduce variance.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3sc1u","text":"Virus neutralization assays provide a means to quantitate functional antibody responses that block virus infection. These assays are instrumental in defining vaccine and therapeutic antibody potency, immune evasion by viral variants, and post-infection immunity. This protocol describe a means by which to measure neutralizing antibody titers in a live virus microneutralization assay specific for severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). The SARS-CoV-2 microneutralization assay is based on the influenza virus microneutralization assay described by WHO. In this assay, SARS-CoV-2 clinical isolates are pre-incubated with serial diluted antibody and added to Vero E6 cells. Replicating virus is quantitated by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) targeting the SARS-CoV-2 nucleocapsid protein and the 50% virus inhibition titer calculated. The assay has been systematically optimized at critical test parameters that include virus titration, assay linearity, number of cells, viral dose, incubation period post-inoculation, and normalization methods.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"55tep","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"64n3d","text":"This protocol has three parts:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1gms4","text":"Part I: Determination of the 50% tissue culture infectious dose per milliliter (TCID50/mL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":84,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3u3ht","text":"Part II: ELISA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4687k","text":"Part III: Virus microneutralization assay.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cvp89","text":"Seeding Vero E6 cells (from T75 flask)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ffcd6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"8qg5j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"gda9","text":"Perform all steps aseptically in a Biosafety 2 flow hood. Do not allow the cell monolayer to dry. Avoid touching the cell monolayer with pipette tips. Optimal cell passage number is between 8 and 20. Below passage 8, cells are more susceptible to infection and vary with each passage. Cell susceptibility is more stable between passage 8 and 20, to minimize inter-assay variation.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4eboc","text":"Verify that Vero E6 cells growing in maintenance media are actively growing (monolayer 70-95% confluent).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eb8vq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9jqs9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":17,"offset":37,"style":"bold"}],"key":"e17mf","text":"Do not use cells that are overgrown. Maintenance media: Dulbecco's Modified Eagle's Medium, Penicillin-Streptomycin (final concentration 10 U/mL), Fetal Bovine Serum (final concentration v/v 10%). Prepare fresh.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"875v8","text":"Remove the maintenance media from the flask with a serological pipette and discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"i6k0","text":"Add 5 mL of phosphate buffered saline (PBS) to the cell monolayer and tilt the flask to cover and wash the whole monolayer. Remove the PBS with a serological pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3t2bh","text":"Add 2 mL 10X TrypLE dissociation media to the flask. Tilt the flask to ensure all cells are covered, and remove the dissociation media with a pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"67cob","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"aqsle","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4huck","text":"Undiluted 10X TrypLE dissociation media is used for cells that are difficult to detach from the flask surface. It may be possible to use diluted TrypLE e.g. 1X or 2X, but this needs to be evaluated empirically.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5rtn8","text":"Place the flask horizontally in a 37 °C, 5% CO2 incubator and incubate for 10 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":46,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"16uu4","text":"Add 10 mL maintenance media to the flask and gently wash cells from the flask surface. Pipette up and down to mix the single cell suspension.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":10,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9cnto","text":"Determine the cell number. Combine 10 μL of the resuspended cells with 10 μL Trypan Blue. Count the cells on a hemocytometer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1flp8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9k6nu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1qi9h","text":"If using an automated cell counter, be aware of the cell counter's dynamic range and accuracy for different input cell numbers. To reduce cell number variation as a factor of inter-assay variance, it is important to use an accurate and consistent method for cell counting.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dlm30","text":"Adjust the cell concentration to 1 × 105 cells/mL with maintenance media and transfer 100 μL to each well in a 96 well plate (10 000 cells per well) using a multichannel pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":39,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":55,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9b7k6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"8vsei","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4trie","text":"To ensure cell numbers are constant for all wells, mix the cell suspension well each time before transferring cells to a new column in the 96-well plate.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"81mk8","text":"Incubate the 96-well plate containing the cells overnight under standard tissue culture conditions (37 °C, 5% CO2) for use the following day.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":112,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ck99u","text":"SARS-CoV-2 virus titration","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5k4vb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"44gho","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e60f3","text":"Perform these steps aseptically according to institutional and laboratory Biosafety Level 3 procedures.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6efba","text":"Thaw a vial of each virus stock just prior to use. Dilute 10 μL virus in 90 μL virus diluent (1:10 dilution).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":79,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5pl5t","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"3ld4s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"a1g7j","text":"Virus diluent: Dulbecco's Modified Eagle's Medium, Penicillin-Streptomycin (final concentration 10 U/mL), Bovine Serum Albumin (final concentration v/v 1%), HEPES buffer (final concentration 25 mM). Prepare fresh.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"gmvv","text":"In a sterile 96-well dilution plate, prepare a ½ log (3.16-fold) serial dilution of the viruses in virus diluent (illustrated in the accompanying figure).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":99,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9u8h3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"82gc3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dm2ei","text":"Add 158 μL of virus diluent to column 1 and 120 μL of virus diluent to columns 2 to 12.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":14,"length":13},{"style":"bold","offset":54,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"al5lf","text":"For each virus stock to be titrated, allocate four rows on the 96-well plate for quadruplicate measurements. Add 17.6 μL of the 1:10 diluted virus to column 1, rows A to D (virus 1) and repeat for virus 2 for rows E to H.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5esg7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"3hkd2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bhvv","text":"Change tips between every 17.6 μL virus aliquot transferred to each well in column 1.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8mor4","text":"Using a multichannel pipette, mix column 1 thoroughly and transfer 55 μL from column 1 to column 2. Discard tips.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"518jf","text":"Using clean tips, mix column 2 thoroughly and transfer 55 μL from column 2 to column 3. Discard tips.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3n3sa","text":"Continue with serial dilution to column 11 using clean tips between columns as described in step 2.6. In the final column with virus (column 11), mix thoroughly and discard 55 μL into a disinfectant (e.g. Virkon or sodium hypochlorite).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"60mq4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"52kgr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fr57c","text":"The final volume in all columns should be 120 μL. Column 12 is the negative control column.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"buks","text":"Place plate(s) at 37 °C, 5%CO2 for 1 hour.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":29,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c1keo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"fca7v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6vejg","text":"This step simulates the virus neutralization assay conditions in which the titered virus will be used.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eltac","text":"Remove the 96-well tissue culture plate seeded with 10 000 Vero E6 cells per well the day before from the 37°C, 5%CO2 incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":116,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3fgkb","text":"Aspirate the cell culture media from the cell monolayer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"886nj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"1k66k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"deldn","text":"Aspirate slowly to not disturb the cell monolayer. Keep monolayer intact by not scraping the well bottom with the pipette tip. Do not allow the cells to dry out.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"79sdt","text":"Gently wash the cell monolayer twice with 100 μL sterile PBS. Remove the PBS with a pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2nc2u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"eb0ma","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"beb6a","text":"Observe the monolayer condition under a microscope before and after washing. It is very important to minimize cell loss at this step, since it will introduce variance. If substantial cell loss is observed, first practice and optimize the technique to preserve the monolayer and repeat the experiment.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cf2kk","text":"Add 100 μL of serial diluted virus to the Vero E6 cell monolayer in the same order as in the dilution plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5imsl","text":"Incubate for 96 hours at 37°C, 5%CO2. Thereafter, the cells are fixed to the plate for the ELISA (described in the Section 3 and 4 of this protocol).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":35,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7rfp7","text":"Using the optical density values from the ELISA, calculate the 50% tissue culture infectious dose using the method described by Reed and Muench (1938), see attached file.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4d6uq","text":"Fixation of cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d90k3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9mut3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3cjh7","text":"Perform these steps according to institutional and laboratory Biosafety Level 3 procedures. It is not necessary to work aseptically. Do not allow cells to dry out after removing medium and PBS.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"flrj","text":"Prepare fixative and pre-cool at -20°C until just before use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3fq1a","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"4he27","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d6a0q","text":"Fixative: 80% acetone (v/v) in PBS (does not need to be sterile).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ej6j","text":"Remove the 96-well tissue culture plate with SARS-CoV-2 cells from the 37°C, 5%CO2 incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":81,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5shko","text":"Remove the medium from all the cells in the tissue culture plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"44fok","text":"Gently wash the wells with 200 μL PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"qab7","text":"Remove the PBS and add 100 μL cold fixative to each well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"adch1","text":"Cover the plate with a lid and incubate at room temperature for 10 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4pctv","text":"Remove fixative with a pipette or by flicking onto stacked paper towel and let the plate air dry (approximately 10-20 minutes).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"erltb","text":"Proceed with ELISA directly (step 4 in this protocol) or add 50 µL 50% glycerol, cover with an adhesive plate seal and store at -20°C until ELISA can be done.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7v45h","text":"Anti-SARS-CoV-2 nucleocapsid ELISA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ajoi8","text":"Dilute the primary antibody (Cat # bsm-41414; Bioss USA; SARS-CoV-2 nucleocapsid mouse mAb, clone 7E1B) 1:4000 in dilution buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":114,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7pbji","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"eh2ut","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":17,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"7if1f","text":"Dilution buffer: SSI Diagnostica Cat. # 24212 + 2% Bovine Serum Albumin or equivalent.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4c8hr","text":"Add 250 μL wash buffer per well to the 96-well plate with fixed cells and soak for 30 seconds at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2knlc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"eu76b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":12,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"8qiq0","text":"Wash buffer: 1% (v/v) Triton-X100 in PBS. Alternatively, 0.05% Tween20 (v/v) in PBS.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dgatk","text":"Flick wash buffer out over a sink.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9mj7d","text":"Repeat wash steps twice [repeat steps (4.2 and 4.3) × 2]. After the last wash, gently tap the 96-well plate upside-down on stacked tissue paper to remove excess wash buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4tgea","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6jvds","text":"Add 100 μL of the diluted primary antibody to each well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1r5bt","text":"Cover the plate(s) with a plate sealer and incubate for 5 minutes on shaking incubator (300 rpm) at room temperature and then for 1 hour at 37°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fm7qf","text":"Dilute the horse radish peroxidase (HRP)-conjugated secondary antibody (Cat. # A16078; Invitrogen; goat anti-mouse IgG/HRP highly cross-adsorbed) 1:10000 in dilution buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":157,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bcq89","text":"Wash the plate(s) three times with wash buffer as before [repeat steps (4.2 and 4.3) × 3]. After the last wash, gently tap the 96-well plate upside-down on stacked tissue paper to remove excess wash buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aq432","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dad8f","text":"Add 100 μL of the diluted HRP-conjugated secondary antibody to each well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b8t5n","text":"Cover the plate(s) with a plate sealer and incubate for 5 minutes on shaking incubator (300 rpm) at room temperature and then for 1 hour at 37°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ajcua","text":"Wash the plate(s) five times with wash buffer as before [repeat steps (4.2 and 4.3) × 5].","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"31bge","text":"Add 250 μL distilled water per well to the 96-well plate and flick out over the sink without an incubation. Repeat twice. After final wash with distilled water, gently tap the plate upside-down on stacked tissue paper to remove excess water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fl8t1","text":"Add 100 μL 3,3',5,5'-tetramethylbenzidine (TMB; Cat. # 4380; Kementec; TMB One) substrate to each well. Do not cover plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b6g6n","text":"Incubate for 15-30 minutes in the dark at room temperature. Monitor colour development.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cj5ni","text":"Add 100 μL stop solution to all wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4on9n","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"opa4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":14,"offset":0,"style":"bold"},{"length":1,"offset":22,"style":"sub"},{"length":1,"offset":25,"style":"sub"}],"key":"cpn8n","text":"Stop solution: 0.2 M H2SO4","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8bkd7","text":"Read the absorbance of the wells at 450 nm (OD450) with 620 nm as reference.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":46,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4o6kj","text":"SARS-CoV-2 virus neutralization","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"46hup","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"dedug","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":22,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"7dsra","text":"Controls and test sera","type":"align-justify"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":3,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"ddatu","text":"a. Test and control sera should be heat-inactivated at 56 °C for 1 hour.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":3,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"2k30f","text":"b. Store sera (before or after heat inactivation) at -20 to -70 °C.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":3,"offset":0,"style":"bold"},{"length":33,"offset":57,"style":"bold"}],"key":"dr6oe","text":"c. If samples are to be tested repeatedly, it is best to make several aliquots of the sera so that the sample is not repeatedly frozen and thawed.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":3,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"7ibbj","text":"d. Positive control: Included in each plate for standardization. Stored at -20 to -70 °C as single-use aliquots.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3bfqf","text":"Negative control: Sera from immune naïve individuals e.g. collected before the pandemic. Stored at -20 to -70 °C as single-use aliquots.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9v01","text":"Prepare sterile 96-well flat bottom plates with 10 000 cells per well as described under Section 1 ‘Seeding Vero E6 cells (from T75 flask)’.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":100,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a6ivf","text":"Incubate cells overnight at 37°C, 5%CO2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":38,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"83dp1","text":"Thaw a vial of virus and place in the biosafety cabinet, mix thoroughly and dilute to 300× TCID50 per 60 μL. Approximately 6 mL/plate is needed. Store on ice or +4°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":95,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bs18r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"f247g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":2,"offset":31,"style":"sub"},{"length":2,"offset":73,"style":"sub"}],"key":"7bsca","text":"Dilute virus stock to 5000 TCID50/mL in 6 mL/plate. This yields 300× TCID50 per 60 μL.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3palj","text":"Add virus diluent to a sterile dilution plate as follows (layout on next page):","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"999k1","text":" a. 108 μL to row A, wells 1-10","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7kchh","text":"    b. 60 μL to rows B-H, wells 1-10","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"72if9","text":"    c. 60 μL to wells A11 – D11 (virus control)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7vvqs","text":"    d. 60 μL to wells B12 – H12 (virus back titration)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"75cai","text":" e. 120 μL to wells E11 – H11 (cells control)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"883p9","text":"Do the serum dilution in a separate sterile 96-well plate","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e4fdu","text":" a. 12 μL serum to the appropriate wells in row A (1:10 serum dilution)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5fkv6","text":" b. Do a 2-fold serial dilution. Sequentially transfer 60 μL from row A through to row H. Mix thoroughly by pipetting.    Discard 60 μL from row H.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cvjgv","text":" c. 60 μL diluted serum remains in each well.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6vr74","text":"Do the virus back titration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"98sp3","text":"a. In column 12, add 120 μL virus to well A12","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"29vq4","text":"b. Do a 2-fold serial dilution of virus - transfer 60 μL from one row to the next, start row A through to row 12. Change tips between dilutions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a60p1","text":"c. Discard 60 μL from well H12","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"co5n6","text":"d. Add 60 μL virus diluent to all wells in column 12 (final volume 120 μL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"catgd","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"foffl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"keus","text":"This virus back titration serves as a control for the virus input amount and changes in sensitivity of cells to the virus infection e.g. early passage cells (passage 1-8) can be more susceptible to infection and reduce the neutralization assay sensitivity and have more positive wells in the back titration, whereas late passage cells (passage \u003e20) can be less susceptible to infection and have fewer positive wells in the back titration. This is also an important control to ensure that the input virus for different strains are the same when comparing antigenicity between different viruses in the same assay.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b1g3h","text":"Add 60 μL diluted virus (300× TCID50) to the following wells:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":34,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9kihp","text":"a. All wells in rows A-H, wells 1-10 (test wells)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bk3b2","text":"b. Wells A11 – D11 (virus control)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"esosc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"770lp","text":"Place plate(s) at 37 °C 5% CO2 for 1 hour.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":29,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"93juu","text":"Approximately 45-50 minutes into the incubation period (step 5.8), remove the 96-well tissue culture plate(s) seeded with 10 000 Vero E6 cells the day before from the 37°C, 5%CO2 incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":177,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5sn46","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6sitt","text":"Aspirate the cell culture media from the cell monolayer. Do not allow cells to dry out.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7sdoj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9oqi0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c1uvp","text":"Aspirate slowly to not disturb the cell monolayer. Keep monolayer intact by not scraping the well bottom with the pipette tip. Do not allow the cells to dry out.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ajjv7","text":"Gently wash the cell monolayer twice with 100 μL sterile PBS. Remove the PBS with a pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dbmh3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"3i0h4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2bcki","text":"Observe the monolayer condition under a microscope before and after washing. It is very important to minimize cell loss at this step, since it will introduce variance. If substantial cell loss is observed, first practice and optimize the technique to preserve the monolayer and repeat the experiment.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e5lg","text":"Add 100 μL serum/virus mix to the Vero E6 cell monolayer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d1nqt","text":"Incubate for 22-24 hours at 37°C, 5%CO2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":38,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"12dgt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"qfc0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fsifv","text":"For Omicron that has a slower cell entry mechanism, incubate for 28-32 hours. Evaluate optimal incubation time in-house based on signal intensity in virus only cells and back titration.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8bb1o","text":"After the incubation period, fix the cells as described in Section 3 'Fixation of SARS-CoV-2 infected cells'","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":70,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"39pta","text":"Perform the ELISA as described in Section 4 'Enzyme linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA)'","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":45,"length":41}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

In most cases, the test dose of virus is acceptable if the back titration is below or equal to the 50% cut-off value in the 5-6 wells containing the lowest dilutions of test virus.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":43,"length":2},{"style":"bold","offset":167,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Quality control, neutralizing antibody titer calculations, and normalization
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"14uv1","text":"Confirm that non-specific inhibition is not present on the plate using the negative serum control. The OD450 of the negative serum control for all dilutions should be similar to that observed for the virus control wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"figcr","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"1gvh5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2lcll","text":"In row A, be aware of a possible edge effect where fewer cells are present. This can lead to a reduced OD value that erroneously represents an inhibition at a serum dilution of 1:10. The negative control is useful for detecting this. If an edge effect is detected, optimize technique to avoid this.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Quality control, neutralizing antibody titer calculations, and normalization
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"64kpa","text":"Assess inter-run variability using the positive control. The serum positive control should give titres within +-1.5-fold of the average values obtained in previous tests.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Quality control, neutralizing antibody titer calculations, and normalization
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"22c6n","text":"Determine the serum 50% neutralization titers as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":57}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Quality control, neutralizing antibody titer calculations, and normalization
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3c7te","text":"Calculate the optical density value cut-off representing 50% virus infection that represents inhibition of 50% virus infection in the neutralization assay i.e. 50% neutralization.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"drq15","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"3tf6a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"formula":"= ((Average OD of Virus Control Wells)+(Average OD of Cell Control Wells))/2","guid":"853C5020E31A11ECAFB84120B2A7D6D6","id":0}}}}

steps.section: Quality control, neutralizing antibody titer calculations, and normalization
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3s6hm","text":"All wells containing diluted serum with an OD value below or equal to the 50% cut-off value are positive for neutralization activity. The reciprocal serum dilution corresponding to that well is the 50% neutralization antibody titre for that serum sample. Serum dilutions are: well A 1:10; well B 1:20; well C 1:40; well D 1:80; well E 1:160; well F 1:320; well G 1:640; and well H 1:1280.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":52,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9ditt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fgmm4","text":"Alternatively, fit a four parameter logistic regression line over all the dilutions for a single sample and calculate the exact 50% neutralization titer as the intercept of the curve with the 50% cut-off OD value.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Quality control, neutralizing antibody titer calculations, and normalization
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1n6t","text":"Normalize 50% neutralization titers to minimize inter-assay variation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":69}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1ties","text":"This method can only be applied to exact titers calculated from four parameter logistic regression curves fitted over all serum dilution data points. It requires an exact titer for the same positive control used in all neutralization assays. This exact positive control titer is obtained by running single-use aliquots of the positive control in the neutralization assay on 8-15 different days with optimal cell passage numbers between 8 and 20. The average positive control titer is referred to here as the nominal value.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":522}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Quality control, neutralizing antibody titer calculations, and normalization
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eiu5i","text":"Use the following equation to determine the normalized 50% neutralization titer for each sample:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f1k03","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"c9d64","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5fgs3","text":"x is the log10 transformed titer of the sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":12,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fo8u4","text":"Pos is the log10titer of the positive control included on the same assay plate as the sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":3},{"style":"sub","offset":14,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"elr1q","text":"Posnom is the average log10 titer of the positive control determined from 8-15 runs denoted as the nominal value of the positive control material.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":6},{"style":"sub","offset":3,"length":3},{"style":"sub","offset":25,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"deb5p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"31ea6","text":"The second fraction calculates the bias of the result from the positive control according to the nominal “expected” value. Thus, if the positive control in a given run has a titer identical to the nominal value, samples will not be corrected. The first fraction describes the relative size of the titer of the sample compared to the maximum titer in a normal assay (here 1:1280). This weighs each titer according to size. Range is adjusted according to the minimum positive value (log10 10 = 1) to exclude normalization for positive samples at the minimum titer of 10, which is the lower limit of quantification. This exclusion is designed to diminish influence of normalization on the qualitative judgement of borderline samples. The correction increases with titer and is greatest at maximal titer (1280).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":484,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"formula":"x×(((x-1)/(Log(1280)-1)  × (〖Pos〗nom-Pos)/Pos)+1)","guid":"F44EDB60E34511ECAFB84120B2A7D6D6","id":0}}}}

title: SARS-CoV-2 live virus neutralization assay
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"3i3th","text":"This assay uses live, replication competent severe acute respiratory syndrome virus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). This pathogen requires Biosafety Level 3 facilities and appropriate training for handling. The assay should be performed according to institutional and laboratory Biosafety Level 3 procedures.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
